intro: Zexmenia arnottii var. confirmans, commonly known as the Western Australian daisy, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Western Australia. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow center. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to the arid and coastal climates of its native habitat. It has a low, spreading growth habit and produces small, narrow leaves. Zexmenia arnottii var. confirmans is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
